text: habiba is preparing breakfast for the 48
people now living in this small house on
the outskirts of kaduna malam Giotto
moved here with his young family after
fleeing three times from boko haram
attacks in borno state he holds the
government responsible for his situation
the older brother Abdullah he now
supports his siblings and there are many
young children Salaam alaikum malam tato
tells me he is desperate for a change
but he won't take part in this election
in kaduna we cannot be able to fall
because we iris iris that my father
Scott in May degree so I need to go
there to cast my vote in medically so
what I don't have means to transport
myself this family is not unique the
hospitality of Nigerians means that well
over half of the displaced people have
been taken in by relatives as election
campaigns are rounding up in Nigeria the
electoral body has confirmed that all
internally displaced persons can only
vote in that state of origin they say
they have no time for anything else and
is quite difficult to work out their
numbers goodluck jonathan's government
is accused of allowing the violence to
continue in the northeast to weaken the
opposition's chances but the ruling
party clearly has its supporters
I caught up with the vice-president
namadi at a rally in zaria near
kaduna and put this accusation to him
this political gimmicks in order to
detract people from the right theme and
it took time for us to train our
security agencies and for us to equip
them because as you know if you even in
Nigeria I believe if we are to be
honnest we have done extremely well but
many displaced people are not so
convinced some told us that if
opposition candidate general Bihari won
the election they would immediately pack
up their things and go back home such is
their faith in these former military
man's ability to bring an end to the
insurgency after like era Abu Bakr BBC
News kaduna
